CURRENTLY HIRING! 📢 [KA Channel Assistant]Polibeli (part of Xingyun Group) is a B2B e-commerce platform whose investment base originates from Singapore and is located in Jakarta, Indonesia, was founded in 2022. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs and shop-owners to pursue their business dreams with our strong supply chain capabilities and reliable e-commerce platform. Polibeli reaches 16 cities on the island of Java, from Banten to Surabaya. Location: North JakartaNote: Only CVs written in English will be processed Job Description:- Help manage projects, organize meetings, and keep things on track.- Collect sales data and create reports to help improve strategies.- Assist with market research, help plan marketing activities, and monitor their success. - Help with product orders, solve shipping issues, and train the team on product knowledge. Qualifications:- Bachelor's degree (fresh graduates are preferred), with a focus on marketing, project management, or business administration.- Proficient in Chinese or English for communication. - Skilled in Excel, Word, and PPT for data analysis, writing, and presentations.- Strong communication and teamwork skills, quick learner with problem-solving abilities, leadership experience is a plus.- Relevant internship experience is preferred.If you are interested in this role, kindly apply through the job post linked below or this link: https://lnkd.in/gZfXbzxihashtag#loker hashtag#hiring hashtag#admin hashtag#freshgraduate

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? 🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? 🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? 🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? 🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? 🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Cause opening team መሆን በራሱ የሚሰጠዉ another level of experience ስላለው።With all that being said I failed my first interview. After almost few months, with in few minutes of releasing there vacancy online i was the first person to drop my CV on tht day. እርግጠኛ ነሽ ግን ተብዬም ነበር ከፏጥነቴ ብዛት።Yes i made it this time. We attract what we think we deserve እንደሚባለዉ ፍላግት is what we think we deserve at the same time እችላለዉ ብለን ያመንበት ነገር። ከቤቱ ትልቅነትጋ i am sure and i have seen too many fearing to apply with bringing lots of excuses qualified ሆነዉም። ለኔ more than how huge the place looked like I believed i fit well to that place. የኔ አቅም እና ፍላጐት was more huge than the place.  Till this day i dont fear of trying even when failing And now we are here 😎

Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Username: Kelly E. Noble, ACCKelly E. Noble, ACC
Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? After almost few months, with in few minutes of releasing there vacancy online i was the first person to drop my CV on tht day. እርግጠኛ ነሽ ግን ተብዬም ነበር ከፏጥነቴ ብዛት።Yes i made it this time. Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Username: Kelly E. Noble, ACCKelly E. Noble, ACC
Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Kokki Ravintola John Scotts Turku, Yes Your Excellent Staff, Turku hashtag#työpaikat

Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵

🚀 Kotlin 2.1.20 is here, and it’s packed with exciting updates!Here are some key highlights:🛠️ K2 Compiler: •	New default kapt plugin for better performance with annotation processing. •	Lombok plugin now supports @SuperBuilder and improves @Builder compatibility.🌍 Kotlin Multiplatform: •	Experimental DSL to replace Gradle’s Application plugin, simplifying JVM target configuration.⚡ Kotlin/Native: •	New inlining optimization improves runtime performance, showing up to a 9.5% boost in benchmarks.🕹️ Kotlin/Wasm: •	Default custom formatters for better debugging. •	Support for DWARF to improve code inspection in Wasm VMs. •	Migration to Provider API for cleaner and more efficient property handling.📦 Gradle Support: •	Compatibility with Gradle’s Isolated Projects. •	Support for custom Gradle publication variants.📅 Standard Library Enhancements: •	Common atomic types for thread-safe operations in multiplatform projects. •	Improved UUID handling with new parsing and formatting functions. •	New Clock and Instant classes for precise time tracking without timezone complexities.🎨 Compose Compiler: •	Relaxed restrictions on @Composable functions — now with support for default arguments in open functions. •	Source information is now included by default across all platforms, enhancing debugging and tooling.📖 Plus: Notable improvements in Kotlin documentation!More info: https://lnkd.in/d762256EWhat are you most looking forward to in this release? Kokki Ravintola John Scotts Turku, Yes Your Excellent Staff, Turku hashtag#työpaikat

Ever wonder what the Dark Side of Networking looks like? 👻 💼When someone submits a ghost referral using your name without your knowledge it can lead to a range of issues for both parties. A ghost referral can backfire on the in several ways:🚫 Instant Rejection – If the hiring team realizes the referral was unauthorized, it could raise red flags and lead to immediate disqualification.🔄 Damaged Credibility – If you’re caught misusing someone’s name, it signals dishonesty and lack of professionalism, harming your reputation before you even get a chance to interview.📉 Lost Future Opportunities – Many companies track applications, and a bad impression now could impact your chances if you apply again in the future.⏳ Wasted Time for Hiring Teams – Recruiters prioritize referrals because they assume they come with a personal endorsement. A ghost referral can waste valuable resources on unqualified candidates.💼 It Could Impact the Future Referrals – If this happens too often, actual referrals might carry less weight, making it harder to help people that deserves the support.Instead of trying to take shortcuts, focus on building genuine relationships and earning a referral the right way. Trust and integrity go a long way in the hiring process.Do you have a referral horror story? Drop your story in the comments! ⬇️hashtag#ProfessionalHorrorStories hashtag#GhostReferrals hashtag#NetworkingDoneRight hashtag#JobSearchTips hashtag#CareerGrowth hashtag#Networking hashtag#LinkedInHorrorStory hashtag#CareerTip hashtag#JobTip hashtag#CareerAdvice hashtag#JobAdvice hashtag#Referral hashtag#Referrals hashtag#Hiring

The versatility of Java has given the language a long life. The thing that always amazes me is what you can build with Java and there are probably some well supported tools for just about any problem from full stack applications (Vaadin TymeLeaf), micro web services (Javalin), cluster applications (Spark, Pinot) to CLIs (PicoCLI) all in this languages ecosystem. It may not necessarily be the fastest language with Rust, Golang, and C++ holding the native stick, but then again we see even here GraalVM has come to give you nearly C speeds. The library, and ecosystem support is phenomenal. When I write other languages I don't have the myriad of frameworks to simplify common problems to allow me to focus on what matters (Spring, Micronaut, Quarkus to name a few), the fact that I can name more than one high quality production ready framework is something most languages don't have. Additionally you can develop your applications intentionally as you want, employing design patterns. Lastly, after spending time in other communities you won't hear a Java developer say 'yeah that's by design, that...', for poorly orchestrated language features, we acknowledge they exist and simply agree that not everything in the language is perfect. ☕

Post Content:
I don’t usually post twice in a day, but this annoyed me enough to do just that. 🤨I see a LOT of job postings. And I love to read them! I know a lot of seekers and try to share relevant or interesting roles with my people. So when I saw this one, I was like “Oh! I know some people who would love this!” 🤩Until I kept reading. 🧐It’s clearly marked Remote—*not* Hybrid—but keep reading, and you’ll see that you’re expected to be onsite 3 days a week here in beautiful NC. Maybe that will work for some folks! But what about the people who trusted your “Remote” assertion? The best applicants will read thoroughly, of course, but folks are tired, scared, and yeah, desperate. 😩This is a shady tactic and it’s got to stop. Mistakes happen, but this one? This feels a little suss. 🩵 Employers: Please be more careful in this market, where hiring employers already seem to have all the power. 🩵
